name.japanese: リトルイーストブルー

description: An island on the Grand Line that recreates the East Blue, featuring replicas of landmarks from the Straw Hats' home sea including a giant windmill like Foosha Village, a training hall from Shimotsuki Village, Baratie, and a mansion reminiscent of Kaya's home.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Little East Blue
keyEvents.description: Boss takes Luffy, Zoro, Usopp, and Sanji to Little East Blue, revealing the island's unique nature as a recreation of the East Blue.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces the main setting for the Little East Blue arc.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of East Blue Replicas
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats discover replicas of their home locations on the island.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the nostalgic and unique nature of Little East Blue.

keyEvents.title: Luffy vs Largo
keyEvents.description: Luffy battles Largo on Little East Blue to protect the island and Boss.
keyEvents.significance: Main conflict location for the episode.

statusHistory.reason: Island is inhabited and functioning normally

description: The world's most secure prison, located in the Calm Belt. Shiki became the first prisoner to escape from this fortress by cutting off his own legs.

keyEvents.title: Shiki's Escape from Impel Down
keyEvents.description: Twenty years ago, Shiki escapes from Impel Down by cutting off his shackled legs and using his Devil Fruit powers.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the only successful prison break before Luffy's mass breakout.

keyEvents.title: Fuwa Fuwa no Mi Used to Escape
keyEvents.description: Shiki demonstrates his Float-Float Fruit abilities to levitate away from Impel Down.
keyEvents.significance: First time the Fuwa Fuwa no Mi is shown being used for escape.

statusHistory.reason: Prison remains operational despite Shiki's escape
